subject: Re: [junit] Re: Ant could not create task : junit
msgSnippet: ... I haven t looked at your classpath, but this looks like a classloader issue. I d recommend sticking junit.jar in ANT_HOME/lib and seeing how you get on,
messageBody:
On 4/26/05, Clark I Anderson <anderci@...> wrote:
> Thank you!
>
> I opened ant-junit.jar in Eclipse. Some of it was readable. There was a
> list of org files near the beginning and near the end. In the Eclipse
> browser the file was a number of pages long. I guess this might indicate
> that the ant-junit.jar file is complete.
>
> I have added:
> <pathelement location="${ANT_HOME}/lib/ant-junit.jar" />
> and:
> <pathelement
> path="${JUNIT_HOME}/junit/tests/framework" />
> to the unit-test Ant task:
> :
> :
> :
> <target name="unit-test" depends="test-var">
>
> <junit printsummary="true" haltonfailure="true" >
> <classpath>
> <pathelement location="${JUNIT_HOME}/junit.jar" />
> <pathelement location="${ANT_HOME}/lib/ant-junit.jar" />
> <pathelement path="build/classes" />
> <pathelement path="test/classes" />
> <pathelement
> path="${JUNIT_HOME}/junit/tests/framework" />
> <pathelement path="${JAVA_HOME}/bin" />
> <pathelement path="${JAVA_HOME}/lib" />
> </classpath>
> <batchtest fork="yes" >
> <formatter type="plain" usefile="false" />
> <fileset dir="test/classes">
> <include name="AllTests.class" />
> <include name="SimpleFractionTest.class" />
> </fileset>
> </batchtest>
>
> </junit>
>
> <echo>junit-run complete!</echo>
> </target>
> :
> :
> :
>
> I get the same result?
>
> Can anyone see what is wrong with the classpath in my build.xml?
>

I haven't looked at your classpath, but this looks like a classloader
issue. I'd recommend sticking junit.jar in ANT_HOME/lib and seeing how
you get on, preferably with a simpler call to <junit/> that doesn't
have all the unnecessary paths defined.

If you don't want to go that route, there are a whole load of threads
about this and different ways of dealing with it on the ant-users
list, which have public searchable archives; e.g. see
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-user&r=1&w=2

James
